chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly A Stukel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 2 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 4, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended if Agent deems appropriate.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with the victim (D.J.) listed in the Criminal Complaint.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed in court.

Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kimberly A Stukel in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz. 

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Victim presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 3:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
2 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Count 4.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or Domestic Violent Counseling and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended if agent deems appropriate.
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim (D.J.) listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.






Count 4:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
2 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Count 3.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 3.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.
